trans-unit.source: How to describe resources in a service manifest
trans-unit.target: How to describe resources in a service manifest

trans-unit.source: The service manifest allows resources to be used by the service to be declared/changed without changing the compiled code.
trans-unit.target: The service manifest allows resources to be used by the service to be declared/changed without changing the compiled code.

trans-unit.source: Service Fabric supports configuration of endpoint resources for the service.
trans-unit.target: Service Fabric supports configuration of endpoint resources for the service.

trans-unit.source: The access to the resources specified in the service manifest can be controlled via the SecurityGroup in the application manifest.
trans-unit.target: The access to the resources specified in the service manifest can be controlled via the SecurityGroup in the application manifest.

trans-unit.source: The declaration of resources allows these resources to be changed at deployment time rather than requiring the service to introduce a new configuration mechanism.
trans-unit.target: The declaration of resources allows these resources to be changed at deployment time rather than requiring the service to introduce a new configuration mechanism.

trans-unit.source: When an Endpoint resource is defined in the service manifest, Service Fabric assigns ports from the reserved application port range.
trans-unit.target: When an Endpoint resource is defined in the service manifest, Service Fabric assigns ports from the reserved application port range.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, services can also request for a specific port in a resource.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, services can also request for a specific port in a resource.

trans-unit.source: Service replicas running on different cluster nodes can be assigned different port numbers, while replicas of the same service running on the same node share the same port.
trans-unit.target: Service replicas running on different cluster nodes can be assigned different port numbers, while replicas of the same service running on the same node share the same port.

trans-unit.source: Such ports can be used by the service replicas for various purposes like replication, listening for client requests, etc.
trans-unit.target: Such ports can be used by the service replicas for various purposes like replication, listening for client requests, etc.

trans-unit.source: Refer to [configuring stateful Reliable Services](../Service-Fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-configuration.md) to read more about referencing endpoints from the config package settings file (settings.xml).
trans-unit.target: Refer to [configuring stateful Reliable Services](../Service-Fabric/service-fabric-reliable-services-configuration.md) to read more about referencing endpoints from the config package settings file (settings.xml).

trans-unit.source: The following service manifest defines 1 TCP endpoint resource and 2 HTTP endpoint resources in the <Resources> element.
trans-unit.target: The following service manifest defines 1 TCP endpoint resource and 2 HTTP endpoint resources in the <Resources> element.

trans-unit.source: HTTP endpoints are automatically ACL'd by Service-Fabric.
trans-unit.target: HTTP endpoints are automatically ACL'd by Service-Fabric.
